criterion: Reward for accurately documenting the patient's reported concerns and symptom course (increased pain intensity, day-to-day variability, worry that hydroxychloroquine may be insufficient).
Reward for faithfully capturing the clinician's counseling and management plan (allow more time on current therapy, monitor closely, consider dose adjustment or alternative options).
Reward for precisely recording the medication-adherence detail that the patient takes folic acid daily, influenced by her support group.
Reward for including relevant chart elements only when referenced (current RA diagnosis, sulfa allergy, current medications with correct names and dosages) and omitting unrelated chart data.
Reward for overall completeness: the note contains every clinically relevant fact, question, and answer explicitly or implicitly present in the transcript without distortion.
Penalize for introducing information, assessments, diagnoses, orders, instructions, or plans not present or reasonably implied in the transcript or supported by the chart.
Penalize for factual inaccuracies or distortions in any copied or transcribed detail (medication names or dosages, frequencies, demographics, clinician statements, patient quotes).
Penalize for omitting any major encounter element (patient concerns, symptom course, medication adherence details, clinician plan), thereby reducing completeness.
Penalize for copying or pasting irrelevant or incorrect chart information (e.g., unrelated conditions, family history, boilerplate templates).
